event: mucosal resection for early gastric cancer
partial resection for left lung cancer
collected knee-high wild grass from a riverbed
Glasgow Coma Scale of 14: E3, V5, M6
crusted skin lesions on the medial surface of the left thigh
freely movable adenopathy of approximately 2 cm in size
aggregated papules in the right inguinal region
no remarkable head-and-neck or chest abnormalities
neutrophil count was considerably low at 899 /μL
activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) of 48.2 seconds
elevations in concentrations of aspartate aminotransferase (AST) at 230 U/L
screened closely for potential antibodies specific for cytomegalovirus and Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)
hemophagocytosis with fewer mature myeloid series cells and more monocytoid and lymphoid cells
immunohistological examination revealed a high number of CD3- and CD4-positive T cells
severe left ventricular dysfunction [left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) of 15%]
electrocardiogram (ECG) showed a slight ST elevation in the V1-2 leads
infection control in the intensive care unit (ICU)
submitted his serum and urine samples and throat swabs to a responsible public health center
reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) analysis of the submitted serum detected 1.77×106 SFTSV RNA copies/mL
submitted pathological sections of his bone marrow to the Division of Virology
infected cells that were stained positively by an anti-SFTSV-nucleoprotein (N) antibody
withdrew from circulatory agonist and ventilator management
ECG showed improvement of ST elevation in the V1-2 leads
re-submitted his serum and confirmed negativity for viremia
no coronary artery stenosis was observed on CAG
pathological evaluation of the EMB specimen revealed that the myocardium was mildly hypertrophic
active mononuclear cell infiltration adjacent to the damaged myocardium was not observed
immunohistochemistry revealed increases in the number of CD3-positive T cells
transthoracic echocardiography showed a slight improvement with an EF of 52.5%
